Amazons

Yellow-naped Amazon

Known for their striking green plumage and a distinct yellow patch on the nape of the neck, which grows with age. They have a robust build and a powerful beak.

Origin
Central & South America
Size
14-16 inches (35.5-41 cm). Weight: 480-600g (17-21 oz)
Weight
540g avg.
Noise Level
Very Loud. They have powerful voices and are known for their enthusiastic screaming sessions, especially in the morning and evening.

Looking for a Yellow-naped Amazon?

See Available Yellow-naped Amazon Listings

Species Ratings

Talking Ability 1/10
Noise Level 9/10
Social Needs 6/10
Cuddliness 5/10

Temperament & Personality

Highly intelligent, outgoing, and often comical. They can be prone to hormonal aggression ('bluffing') during adolescence and breeding season.

Vocalization & Talking Ability

Exceptional talkers and singers. Many can develop extensive vocabularies and learn full songs.

Dietary Needs

Prone to obesity. Requires a diet low in fat, based on high-quality pellets, with a large variety of fresh vegetables and limited fruit and nuts.

Health & Lifespan

Long-lived (50-80+ years) and require experienced handling. Vulnerable to obesity, fatty liver disease, and Vitamin A deficiency. Regular exercise is essential.

Housing Requirements

Needs a large space. A cage no smaller than 36"W x 24"D x 48"H is needed, but bigger is better. Unsuitable for apartments due to high noise levels.

Common Questions About Yellow-naped Amazon

What is the lifespan of a Yellow-naped Amazon?

The Yellow-naped Amazon typically lives for 50-80+ years. With proper care, diet, and regular vet check-ups, they can live a full and healthy life.

Is the Yellow-naped Amazon good for beginners?

This species is rated as 'advanced' care level. They require specific attention, socialization, or dietary needs that may challenge first-time owners.

Where does the Yellow-naped Amazon come from?

The Yellow-naped Amazon is native to Central & South America.

More Amazons

Blue-fronted Amazon

Loud. While maybe not as intense as the Yellow-naped, they can and will scream to get attention or express excitement.

Double Yellow-headed Amazon

Very Loud. Possess an extremely powerful voice and are not shy about using it.

Green-cheeked Amazon

Loud. They have a high-pitched, loud call.
